Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: http://www.skotos.net/IronclawGame/images/maps/trisk.jpg
a classroom

A classroom. A group of cardboard boxes are lined up against the west wall. Five desks with attached swivel chairs have been placed in an orderly semi-circle. A large, green chalkboard is hung on the south wall. There are no visible exits. It appears education is forced here.
A classroom.
A classroom. A group of cardboard boxes are lined up against the west wall. Five desks with attached swivel chairs have been placed in an orderly semi-circle. There are no visible exits.
http://www.skotos.net/IronclawGame/images/maps/Staff/classroom.jpg
the cardboard boxes
A group of cardboard boxes are sitting next to the west wall. They are meant as storage yet appear mostly unused.
A group of cardboard boxes are sitting next to the west wall.
the cardboard chatter box

A cardboard box with the word CHATTERS typed on a white sheet of paper and taped to the front. Oddly, you can crawl into it.
Peeking inside, you see:
A cardboard box with the word CHATTERS typed on a white sheet of paper and taped to the front.
the cardboard clothing and weapons box

A cardboard box with the words CLOTHING and WEAPONS neatly written with a black Sharpie. Oddly, you can crawl into it.
Peeking inside, you see:
A cardboard box with the words CLOTHING and WEAPONS neatly written with a black Sharpie.
the cardboard miscellaneous box

A cardboard box with the word MISCELLANEOUS placed on the front using cut-out letters from old newspapers. Oddly, you can crawl into it.
Peeking inside, you see:
A cardboard box with the word MISCELLANEOUS placed on the front using cut-out letters from old newspapers.
the cardboard toy box

A cardboard box with the word TOYS scrawled in crayon. Oddly, you can crawl into it.
Peeking inside, you see:
A cardboard box with the word TOYS scrawled in crayon.
the ceiling

A very plain, nondescript ceiling. Seriously, this is boring. Okay, just for you... it's made of wooden boards and one of them has a knothole. I don't know what kind of wood! Stop examining everything!
A very plain, nondescript ceiling.
the chalkboard
A large green chalkboard is hung on the southern wall. Oddly, no erasers or chalk are visible.
A large green chalkboard is hung on the southern wall.
the northeast corner
The northeast corner of the room. Yep, totally a corner.
The northeast corner of the room.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner of the room. This is a corner too. There are three others just like it. Why do you even bother examining this crap?
The northwest corner of the room.
the southeast corner
The southeast corner of the room. Woohoo! You found a corner. Aren't you so smart? No.
The southeast corner of the room.
the southwest corner
The southwest corner of the room. Nothing witty to read here. Move on.
The southwest corner of the room.
the corners of the room
The corners of the room. Yep, totally a big vacuous cube which results in corners.
The corners of the room.
a school desk with an attached chair

One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The top is a flat surface with two parallel grooves near the front for holding writing utensils without allowing them to roll. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place and prevents shifting. This desk has indecipherable scratch marks on the top right corner.
One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place.
a school desk with an attached chair

One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The top is a flat surface with two parallel grooves near the front for holding writing utensils without allowing them to roll. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place and prevents shifting. There is gum stuck under the seat.
One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place.
a school desk with an attached chair

One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The top is a flat surface with two parallel grooves near the front for holding writing utensils without allowing them to roll. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place and prevents shifting. Scratches mar the whole surface of the desk top.
One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place.
a school desk with an attached chair

One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The top is a flat surface with two parallel grooves near the front for holding writing utensils without allowing them to roll. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place and prevents shifting. Someone wrote CODING SUCKS across the back of the chair.
One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place.
a school desk with an attached chair

One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The top is a flat surface with two parallel grooves near the front for holding writing utensils without allowing them to roll. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place and prevents shifting. The desk tends to wobble due to a missing foot on one leg.
One of the school desks with an attached chair. It is made mostly from wood with metal legs. The chair is attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place.
the five school desks with chairs attached

The school desks with attached chairs are placed in a semi-circle facing the chalkboard. They are made mostly from wood with metal legs. The tops are a flat surface with two parallel grooves near the front for holding writing utensils without allowing them to roll. The chairs are attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place and prevents shifting.

The school desks with attached chairs are placed in a semi-circle facing the chalkboard. They are made mostly from wood with metal legs. The chairs are attached by a metal post on the left side requiring the student to slide into place.
the floor
The wooden floor is under you. That's the best place I could think to put the floor. I'm glad it meets your approval. Try not to get a sliver.
The wooden floor is under you. That's the best place I could think to put the floor.
the pile of hay
A scattered pile of green and yellow hay. You might be able to pull a piece out.
A scattered pile of green and yellow hay. You might be able to pull a piece out.
the middle of the room
The exact center of the room. It's basically empty. Who the hell puts things in the exact center of the room. Not very feng shui.
The exact center of the room. It's basically empty.
piece of green straw
A piece of green straw among a whole bunch included in a haypile.
A piece of green straw among a whole bunch included in a haypile.
piece of yellow straw
A piece of yellow straw among a whole bunch included in a haypile.
A piece of yellow straw among a whole bunch included in a haypile.
the east wall
The east wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room. You going to examine them all?
The east wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room.
the north wall
The north wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room. You going to examine them all?
The north wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room.
the south wall
The south wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room. This one happens to have a large green chalkboard on it. Oddly, no erasers or chalk are visible.
The south wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room. This one happens to have a large green chalkboard on it.
the west wall
The west wall. A group of cardboard boxes are lined up against this wall.
The west wall. Goody for you, you found a wall in a room.
the walls
There are walls surrounding the room. What did you think you were going to see? Friggan morons and their overuse of the examine command.
There are walls surrounding the room. Duh?

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "It's like totally evening now. We are inside and there are no windows, we must be psychic or maybe psychotic."); return TRUE;
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "It's midday. What the hell is wrong with you? It's called noon, people!"); return TRUE;
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "Okay, so it just turned midnight. How the hell can you even tell from here? Is your huge cogwheel clock strapped to your thigh or something?"); return TRUE;
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "Good morning! Chances are you should be doing something productive, yet here you sit. Lazy bastage."); return TRUE;

X[M] if (NRefDetail(\$iob[0]) == "box-chatters") \{ EmitIn(\$this, Describe(\$actor) +" crawls over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappears inside.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You crawl over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappear inside."); \$dest = \$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:ChatterBox\}; Set(\$actor, "base:environment", \$dest); EmitIn(\$dest, Describe(\$actor) + " climbs down the east side of the box and crouches low expecting it to be smaller in here.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You climb down the east side of the box and crouch low expecting it to be quite small inside."); \$proxy = NewNRef( \$dest, "wall-east" ); \$actor."base:preposition" = 8; \$actor."base:proximity" = \$proxy; (\$delay, 1); \$glance = UnSAM(Get(\$dest, "details:default:description:glance")); EmitTo(\$actor, Str(\$glance)); \} else if (NRefDetail(\$iob[0]) == "box-clothing") \{ EmitIn(\$this, Describe(\$actor) +" crawls over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappears inside.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You crawl over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappear inside."); \$dest = \$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:ClothingBox\}; Set(\$actor, "base:environment", \$dest); EmitIn(\$dest, Describe(\$actor) + " climbs down the east side of the box and crouches low expecting it to be smaller in here.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You climb down the east side of the box and crouch low expecting it to be quite small inside."); \$proxy = NewNRef( \$dest, "wall-east" ); \$actor."base:preposition" = 8; \$actor."base:proximity" = \$proxy; (\$delay, 1); \$glance = UnSAM(Get(\$dest, "details:default:description:glance")); EmitTo(\$actor, Str(\$glance)); \} else if (NRefDetail(\$iob[0]) == "box-misc") \{ EmitIn(\$this, Describe(\$actor) +" crawls over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappears inside.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You crawl over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappear inside."); \$dest = \$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:MiscBox\}; Set(\$actor, "base:environment", \$dest); EmitIn(\$dest, Describe(\$actor) + " climbs down the east side of the box and crouches low expecting it to be smaller in here.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You climb down the east side of the box and crouch low expecting it to be quite small inside."); \$proxy = NewNRef( \$dest, "wall-east" ); \$actor."base:preposition" = 8; \$actor."base:proximity" = \$proxy; (\$delay, 1); \$glance = UnSAM(Get(\$dest, "details:default:description:glance")); EmitTo(\$actor, Str(\$glance)); \} else if (NRefDetail(\$iob[0]) == "box-toys") \{ EmitIn(\$this, Describe(\$actor) +" crawls over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappears inside.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You crawl over the top of " +Describe(\$iob[0])+ " and disappear inside."); \$dest = \$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:ToyBox\}; Set(\$actor, "base:environment", \$dest); EmitIn(\$dest, Describe(\$actor) + " climbs down the east side of the box and crouches low expecting it to be smaller in here.", \$actor); EmitTo(\$actor, "You climb down the east side of the box and crouch low expecting it to be quite small inside."); \$proxy = NewNRef( \$dest, "wall-east" ); \$actor."base:preposition" = 8; \$actor."base:proximity" = \$proxy; (\$delay, 1); \$glance = UnSAM(Get(\$dest, "details:default:description:glance")); EmitTo(\$actor, Str(\$glance)); \} return TRUE;

X[M] if (NRefDetail(\$what[0]) == "box-chatters") \{ \$bb = UnSAM(Get(\$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:ChatterBox\}, "details:default:description:look")); EmitTo(\$actor, "Peeking inside you see: " +Str(\$bb)); \} else if (NRefDetail(\$what[0]) == "box-clothing") \{ \$bb = UnSAM(Get(\$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:ClothingBox\}, "details:default:description:look")); EmitTo(\$actor, "Peeking inside you see: " +Str(\$bb)); \} else if (NRefDetail(\$what[0]) == "box-misc") \{ \$bb = UnSAM(Get(\$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:MiscBox\}, "details:default:description:look")); EmitTo(\$actor, "Peeking inside you see: " +Str(\$bb)); \} else if (NRefDetail(\$what[0]) == "box-toys") \{ \$bb = UnSAM(Get(\$\{Ironclaw:Staff:Death:Offices:ToyBox\}, "details:default:description:look")); EmitTo(\$actor, "Peeking inside you see: " +Str(\$bb)); \} return TRUE;
